messages.subject: Re: third hand behind my back, kind of...
messages.msgSnippet: He was unschooled too, but chose to go back to school (even paid half of his own tuition to a private school for a year) when he was 15 or so.
messages.messageBody:
He was unschooled too, but chose to go back to school (even paid half of his own tuition to a
private school for a year) when he was 15 or so.

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] third hand behind my back, kind of...
messages.msgSnippet: ... How sweet! It s so exciting he can see the value of your stories and your lifestyle. I imagine he ll be a very different father to his kids (than he
messages.messageBody:
On Jan 30, 2008 12:43 PM, Sandra Dodd <Sandra@...> wrote:

> I just got this on MySpace, from my nephew, Elijah Trujillo, who's
> just a few months older than Kirby (21).
> Sipapu is a small ski resort in northern New Mexico. I don't know if
> Elijah was up there snowboarding or visiting friends or what, but
> this is a cool story. He didn't say whether the mom was local or
> tourist.
>
> Jan 30, 2008 1:05 PM
>
> Subject:
> Your book "Moving A Puddle"
> Body:
> I was up at Sipapu the other day talking to one of my friends about
> learning being inevitable and started telling him about your book.
> Then a few minutes later, this lady walked up to me and said, "Sorry
> for eavesdropping but I heard you talking about that book."
> Apparently she bought a copy of it and she said its having a huge
> impact on the way she's raising her kids. I just thought I'd tell you
> that your book is having an impact on the planet.
> I have a few friends that are new to parenting and I would like for
> them to see the book. I was wondering if maybe I could help you sell
> the book to help spread the message.
>
>
How sweet! It's so exciting he can see the value of your stories and your
lifestyle.
I imagine he'll be a very different father to his kids (than he experienced)
thanks to your input :D
He would be such a great soul to help spread the message! ♥
--
~diana :)
xoxoxoxo
hannahbearski.blogspot.com

messages.subject: third hand behind my back, kind of...
messages.msgSnippet: I just got this on MySpace, from my nephew, Elijah Trujillo, who s just a few months older than Kirby (21). Sipapu is a small ski resort in northern New
messages.messageBody:
I just got this on MySpace, from my nephew, Elijah Trujillo, who's
just a few months older than Kirby (21).
Sipapu is a small ski resort in northern New Mexico. I don't know if
Elijah was up there snowboarding or visiting friends or what, but
this is a cool story. He didn't say whether the mom was local or
tourist.

Jan 30, 2008 1:05 PM

Subject:
Your book "Moving A Puddle"
Body:
I was up at Sipapu the other day talking to one of my friends about
learning being inevitable and started telling him about your book.
Then a few minutes later, this lady walked up to me and said, "Sorry
for eavesdropping but I heard you talking about that book."
Apparently she bought a copy of it and she said its having a huge
impact on the way she's raising her kids. I just thought I'd tell you
that your book is having an impact on the planet.
I have a few friends that are new to parenting and I would like for
them to see the book. I was wondering if maybe I could help you sell
the book to help spread the message.

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
